@graph.name: Songs To Smoke Cigarettes To
@graph.description:
DJs Lil Pri & Josh Lomat

"Songs to Smoke Cigarettes To" is an event that features indie hits, psychedelic rock, and alternative tracks from artists like Tame Impala, Passion Pit, Arctic Monkeys, MGMT, Mac DeMarco, and Pond. It's all about vibing out to the best of indie and alternative music, creating a perfect soundtrack for your night.

@graph.name: Damaged Disco with Hallows and Holy Water
@graph.description:
Join us for a night of modern electronic darkwave as Damaged Disco returns to Gold-Diggers on Thursday March 27 with live performances by Hallows and Holy Water, plus music from resident DJ DAT68!

Hallows is a duo consisting of Vanee Dusoruth and Dom Rolando. The band explores themes of unease, longing, and sadness in their music drawing from traditional darkwave but with a modern electronic approach. The pair released music on labels including Phage Tapes and Cold Transmission before releasing their sophomore album, A Quieter Life, via their in-house label Stoic Media in 2023. Their latest single "Find A Way" came out in February. Hallows is touring throughout March and has performed at festivals including Substance Fest, Verboden Fest, and Sanctum.

Holy Water combines a love of electronic dance music with the energy and ethos of punk and hardcore. Jacob Desrochers established Holy Water in 2018 after 12 years doing DJ gigs playing indie dance, tech house, industrial, and post-punk. Jacob came up in the Northern California punk/hardcore scene. His band Lonely Kings released four albums on Fearless Records and toured with bands like At The Drive In, Hot Water Music, The Misfits, and AFI. Since forming Holy Water he has shared the stage with acts including Soft Kill, Actors, Adult., TR/ST, Glass Spells, Cold Cave, and Sacred Skin.

With resident DJ DAT68 spinning minimal wave, dark disco, industrial, and post-punk.

Damaged Disco night is a monthly event with live performances of minimal synth and post-punk artists curated by the Damaged Disco label, happening on the last Thursday of each month at Gold-Diggers.

@graph.name: Early James
@graph.description:
Sid The Cat Presents

Early James

with Will Worden

3/28/2025 at Gold-Diggers

21+

Early James recorded his first two Easy Eye Sound albums, Singing For My Supper (2020) and Strange Time To Be Alive (2022), at the studio inside the vaunted label‚Äôs Nashville headquarters. But for James‚Äô third release, Medium Raw, producer and Easy Eye Sound label head Dan Auerbach envisioned something quite different for the Alabama-bred singer-songwriter- guitarist‚Äôs rawboned, sometimes scarifying music.

‚ÄúDay of the first session, I had my GPS routed to Easy Eye,‚Äù James recalls. ‚ÄúWe ran into some traffic, and I texted \[engineer M.\] Allen \[Parker\] ‚Äî ‚ÄòHey man, sorry, we‚Äôre gonna be about 15 minutes late.‚Äô And he said, ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs OK, we‚Äôre still getting set up at the house.‚Äô And I was like, ‚ÄòWhat house?‚Äô ‚ÄòWe‚Äôre recording at this house, it‚Äôs really cool.‚Äô It was news to me! It felt unusual in the moment, which I think makes you play the songs differently. But I‚Äôm really happy with and proud of the results.‚Äù

‚ÄúI wanted to try to find that power of when I first saw him, when it was just him and his guitar,‚Äù Auerbach explains. ‚ÄúAfter working with him a couple of times in the studio, I felt like I wasn‚Äôt going to be able to do it in the same kind of way. The comforts and luxuries of the studio, where you‚Äôre able to hear everything and make adjustments and changes, wasn‚Äôt right for this project.‚Äù

‚ÄúSome of my favorite albums are those Arhoolie records produced by Chris Strachwitz that were recorded in houses, by Fred McDowell, Lightnin‚Äô Hopkins. I felt like we might get better results if we did it in a house.‚Äù

@graph.name: Dopamine: A Night of Feel-Good Disco & House
@graph.description:
RSVP for FREE entry before 10:30PM, $10 at the door after 10:30PM

Step into a world where time slows, the outside world fades away, and the only thing that matters is the rhythm that pulses through your body. Dopamine is more than just a party‚Äîit‚Äôs an escape, a journey into pure euphoria.

As the lights dim and the bass drops, you‚Äôll be transported to a realm where the only thing that matters is the now. The music? Pure bliss. The DJs? Masters of their craft, spinning infectious grooves of feel-good disco and soulful house that sweep you up and carry you into the night. With each beat, the world outside evaporates, and the dancefloor becomes a sanctuary of joy.

@graph.name: 2forever presents ACCIDENTALS
@graph.description:
2forever presents ACCIDENTALS

Featuring:

Sarah & Collin

Magic Candy

Sheep Chase

Accidentals is a night by artists for artists. It is a space to share new music, fine tune unreleased tracks, perform songs that may not fit into a main artist project, and try something new. Come listen to what Los Angeles‚Äôs left field has to offer.

@graph.name: No Return w/ Shana Sarett and Sammie Pearson
@graph.description: Join us for No Return! For one night only... dance floor classics. Madonna, Grace Jones, Prince, Bowie and more... With DJs Shana Sarett and Sammie Pearson

@graph.name: Waltapolooza
@graph.description: A benefit show for Walter (Spaceland) featuring Miss Lonely, Datamaps, Happy Hollows and Crooner. Plus Brian Aubert & Nikki Monninger of Silversun Pickups DJing!

@graph.name: very good mondays
@graph.description:
Alex Wasily's Very Good‚Ñ¢ Mondays is back, this time with featured performances by Julius Rodriguez, Wayne Matthews, Brian Sanborn, Paul Reinhold and Roland Garcia, plus an after-party with DJ Teddy Roxpin.

This is a night of improvised play among some of the most talented musicians in Los Angeles. Mondays have but one rule: no covers!

Follow @very.good.mondays on Instagram for the latest.

@graph.name: Rooting For You w/ Rebecca McBride, Mal.X, iaminfinite
@graph.description:
Rooting For You is a new project from singer-songwriter/producer Andrew Solis (FKA Jonah Sun). Building off of a foundation of past musical projects, failed relationships, an arsenal of analog synths and a well of emotions, RFY creates captivating songs that are best suited to be listened to while driving alone at night on an empty, foggy highway. ‚ÄúMy goal is to reach people with my music and make them feel something, whatever that may be,‚Äù says Solis. ‚ÄúSo much of the current state of things is meant to numb us and make us feel disconnected. But if I can make something that someone can tap into emotionally while also making it enjoyable to listen to, then I‚Äôve done my job.‚Äù

‚Äú There‚Äôs something truly special about discovering and sharing debut singles from emerging artists. The excitement of experiencing something new and fresh is simply unparalleled. Recently, I stumbled upon an amazing indie track that left me in awe. With its dreamy instrumentals and mesmerizing synths, this song is an absolute treat for the ears. ‚Äù - Filip Zemƒç√≠k via Start Track

@graph.name: Mary Chicken Soup and Rice w/ Atlas Engine, Santos & The Crystal Visions
@graph.description: Mary Chicken Soup and Rice w/ Atlas Engine, Santos & The Crystal Visions

@graph.name: GHOST COP
@graph.description:
New York Dark Wave / Post Punk darlings and Synthicide regulars, GHOST COP make their Los Angeles debut.

Blending elements of dark wave, post punk, synth pop, and horror soundtracks, GHOST COP has built an underground following around the world. Comprised of Lucy Swope and Sean Dack, they are as influenced by the gloomy forebears of yesteryear as they are by B- movie soundtracks. Their music ranges from dystopian dance floor heaters to cinematic anthems and vocoder lullabies, pairing strident beats with haunting melodies and lyrical storytelling. They are touring in support of their second full length album TROUBLE, out now.

@graph.name: Gotta Have Soul
@graph.description: Gold Diggers presents ‚ÄúGotta Have Soul‚Äù, a funk / soul / disco party taking place first Thursdays. Featuring DJ Guy Keltner (of Acid Tongue) and DJ Avalon York, the party will feature rare underground vinyl and far out sounds of the 60s and 70s.

@graph.name: Damaged Disco presents Chalk Teeth with Kontrol Inc
@graph.description:
Damaged Disco Presents Chalk Teeth with Kontrol Inc on Friday April 4 at Gold-Diggers! Featuring drink specials by Madre Mezcal.

Shoegaze-tinged, motorik dark wave. Black glass synths, washed in noise-rock guitar, with Polish vocals, propelled by relentless drum machine pulses. Chalk Teeth is a Los Angeles three piece by way of NYC and Oakland traversing iron and beaded curtains. The band features Karolina Wallace (vocals and guitar) and Adam Wallace (guitar) of Radiant Reveries with Jason Miller (synths, bass, drum programming) of Lumerians and Wet Satin.

Kontrol Inc. is a post punk band from the suburbs of Los Angeles.

@graph.name: JUST A TOUCH w/ Hella Breezy and Friends
Grace Cummings
@graph.description:
Sid The Cat Presents

Grace Cummings

with Adriana McCassim

4/5/2025 at Gold-Diggers

21+

Critically acclaimed Australian artist Grace Cummings hit a new high in 2024 with the release of third album, Ramona. ‚ÄúIt felt like the wind of a hurricane entered the room,‚Äù said fan and new friend, Angel Olsen. ‚ÄúI remember feeling so activated and surprised by Grace‚Äôs vocal capacity that I actually felt my body brace itself against the wall.‚Äú

Acclaimed worldwide in outlets ranging from PAPER to The Guardian, Uncut to NPR, Ramona is a work of raw truth rendered in its most beautiful form. In a departure from the self-produced approach of her 2019 debut Refuge Cove and its 2022 follow-up Storm Queen‚Äîthe Melbourne-based artist worked with producer Jonathan Wilson (Angel Olsen, Father John Misty, Margo Price) at his Topanga Canyon studio to dream up a lavishly orchestrated sound that fully accommodates the depth and scope of her vocal prowess.

With its visceral reflection on grief and self-destruction and emotional violence, Ramona brings a stunning new grandeur to Cummings‚Äô music while refusing to soften or temper its humanity. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs emotional and grand, like a metamorphosis in real time,‚Äù Rolling Stone.

@graph.name: New Gloom w/ DJs Toast, Serious Time, Character Armor
@graph.description:
Introducing New Gloom, every first Saturday at Gold-Diggers! üåôü™©

@graph.name: Jake Xerxes Fussell
@graph.description:
Sid The Cat Presents

Jake Xerxes Fussell

with Harrison Whitford

4/6/2025 at Gold-Diggers

21+

Jake Xerxes Fussell is a singer, guitarist, and composer based in Durham, NC. His intuitive creative process often draws from traditional music and archival field recordings - incorporating elements of songs from the past into new work. He is, according to Ann Powers of NPR, "maybe the leading interpreter of American folk music right now..."

Fussell‚Äôs most recent album When I‚Äôm Called was released to critical acclaim by Fat Possum Records in the summer of 2024. The album was produced by James Elkington and features Blake Mills (guitars), Ben Whiteley (bass), and Joe Westerlund (drums), along with additional vocals from Joan Shelley and Robin Holcomb.

Fussell and Elkington also wrote and recorded the music for Rebuilding, a new feature film directed by Max Walker-Silverman that is set to premiere at the 2025 Sundance Film Festival.

‚ÄúFussell‚Äôs music often comes with complex citations; he is a folksinger in the truest sense, collecting ideas and melodies and lyrics from distant and disparate traditions, looking for the things that unite us in our humanity.‚Äù - The New Yorker

‚Äú(Fussell) is one of the great magpies of American song, collecting forgotten, tarnished gems with a folklorist‚Äôs zeal‚Ä¶ his renditions aren‚Äôt so much cover versions as composites‚Ä¶‚Äù ‚Äì The Guardian

@graph.name: very good‚Ñ¢ mondays
@graph.description:
Alex Wasily's Very Good‚Ñ¢ Mondays is back, this time with live performances by Andy Prado, Ollie Lopez, Yosmel Montejo, Andy Waddell, Cole Riddle, Kyle Zimmerman and Alex Williams, plus an after-party with DJ Hella Soosh.

This is a night of improvised play among some of the most talented musicians in Los Angeles. Mondays have but one rule: no covers!

Follow @very.good.mondays on Instagram for the latest.

@graph.name: Shower Curtain, Mo Dotti
@graph.description: shower curtain started as the solo project of Victoria Winter in 2018 in Curitiba, Brazil, and has since developed into a indie rock four piece based out of Brooklyn, NY alongside Ethan Williams (guitar/vocals), Sean Terrell (drums), and Cody Hudgins (bass). shower curtain brings dreamy melodies to the forefront of their music, bolstered by instrumental distortion and insulated by fuzz. Their debut album ‚Äòwords from a wishing well‚Äô was released in October 2024 via Angel Tapes/Fire Talk Records, sketching early adulthood experiences in swirling layers of guitars, bringing the sludgy distortion of 90s shoegaze and grunge and establishing shower curtain as a standout in the city‚Äôs latest crop of bands.

@graph.name: Stepping Stone Presents India Ramey w/ Nocona + DJ Dandy Randy
@graph.description:
India Ramey blazes a trail through cinematic spaghetti western landscapes to wood floored Honkytonks and the Appalachian foothills. India‚Äôs musical journey was not typical. ‚ÄúHaving grown up poor, there was a lot of pressure for me to ‚Äògo to college and make money‚Äô so I convinced myself that music was a hobby‚Äù. Ramey, a domestic violence survivor got a law degree and became a domestic violence prosecutor. ‚ÄúI thought if I was helping people like my Mom, I would like being a lawyer more‚Äù. Despite her love of helping people, Ramey‚Äôs love for music won in the end. She gave up her law career to become a full time musician and songwriter and has never looked back.

Since then Ramey has put out five studio albums. Her 2017 album, and first national release, Snake Handler landed her on Rolling Stone's 10 New Country Artists You Need To Know list and earned her praise and attentions from American Songwriter, The Bluegrass Situation among others . Her 2020 album Shallow Graves earned her even more recognition from the likes of Ralph McClean of the BBC who said "Ramey is a singer of the truth. Long may she shine" and Rolling Stone who named her a pick of the week and featured a full interview and review calling her "Part honky-tonk, part Black Sabbath". She has been a two time SXSW and a three time Americanafest showcasing artist and recently released her fifth studio album, Baptized By The Blaze produced by Luke Wooten (The SteelDrivers, Sunny Sweeney, Deirks Bentley, Brad Paisley).

Released in August 2024, Baptized By The Blaze has taken off and is proving to be India's most successful album yet receiving high praise from Saving Country Music, No Depression, American Songwriter, The Bluegrass Situation and many more. She is touring extensively and has had the pleasure of opening for rising Outlaw Country and Americana star, Corb Lund and Grammy-nominated Maggie Rose. Ramey will start off her 2025 in the line-up of the Sirius XM Outlaw Country Cruise and has spring tour dates filling up her calendar.

@graph.name: Lean w/ Cathryn Lovett
@graph.description:
Earmilk described them best by saying ‚Äúsonically, LEAN's clean textures, smooth and dreamy melodies wrap you up tightly and what a blissful feeling it is. LEAN takes the refreshing approach of keeping things cool and unassuming.‚Äù

McCammon and Johnson met in late 2016 and formed LEAN shortly afterward. The two bonded over their shared love of 90s hip hop and indie rock and quickly found a formula that combined these influences. "With Stephen‚Äôs ear for hooks it came together effortlessly‚Äù McCammon said of the band's conception.

After a stretch of singles, they made their debut with Years in the spring of 2018. In its first year as a band, Lean garnered the praise of NYLON, Indie Shuffle, IMPOSE, Buzz Bands LA: putting them on the radar of Kitsun√©, and high-profile Spotify and Apple Music playlists.

What the press has been saying about Lean:

"The perfect make-out song" - NYLON

"Just good ol' fashioned, high quality indie pop." - Indie Shuffle

"Their single ‚ÄúCome Back‚Äù belies its facade of indie-pop insouciance; it‚Äôs a dart aimed at a poison person." -Buzz Bands LA

@graph.name: Grivo, Lockstep, Kraus, Seko
@graph.description: Emerging like an ornate relic, Austin-based power trio Grivo combines slow, methodical hooks and warm tube amplifiers to artfully re-establish the line between heavy guitars and downtempo pop. Within the tidal sound waves and bleak timbre, Grivo forges a distinctive personal connection that challenges the modern definitions of doom metal and shoegaze.

@graph.name: Subject x Object presents: Sittin‚Äô Sidewayz
@graph.description:
Subject x Object presents:

Sittin‚Äô Sidewayz

With Djs Al Lover, Sean Cee , Rapmane Shane

Feat. country rap tunes, crunk, Jiggy era, y2k r&b, & old school originals

@graph.name: Desert Daze Nights: Deaf Club w/ Object of Affection
@graph.description:
Desert Daze Nights presents Deaf Club w/ Object of Affection!

Deaf Club is a savage sound bath dripping with sardonicism: a blastbeat-centric hardcore punk assault channeling crust, thrash, and grind (un)sensibilities. Succinct pauses, surreal frequencies and effects, breakneck pace and sharply hurled vocals characterize the band‚Äôs aesthetic, which seems as though it is rooted in a sort of nasty-sound-meets-highbrow-message ethos. Fueled by the onslaught of society‚Äôs insanity and driven mad by tinnitus, Justin Pearson (The Locust, Dead Cross, Planet B), Brian Amalfitano (ACxDC), Scott Osment (Weak Flesh), and Jason Klein (Run With The Hunted), approach music as an opportunity to confront our collective sicknesses. We‚Äôve got to try to listen, lest we all frolic headfirst towards the bright side of death, dragging this pillaged planet down with us. So whether you think the music is a radical disruption to the airwaves or just headache-inducing noise, you can feel free to tell them the brutal truth‚Äì they can‚Äôt hear you anyway.

@graph.name: Whatever Forever
@graph.description: A night of indie sleaze, blog house, and whatever the f#%k else. With resident DJ Casio Crybaby. For one night, we're back in the dive bars and dance floors of NYC where it all began. Throw on those AA disco pants and roll in for the party.

@graph.name: Matthew Logan Vasquez
@graph.description:
Sid The Cat Presents

Matthew Logan Vasquez

with Softjaw

4/13/2025 at Gold-Diggers

21+

Best-known as the co-founder and frontman for shapeshifting heartland indie rockers Delta Spirit, Matthew Logan Vasquez's fiery delivery and thought-provoking lyrics draw from a huge and versatile well of influences, including Gordon Gano, Kurt Cobain, Neil Young, and Thom Yorke. As a solo artist, he juggles elements of indie rock, electronic pop, R&B, and soulful Americana, flirting with despondency, but ultimately succumbing to beatitude. Vasquez‚Äôs latest release Frank‚Äôs Full Moon Saloon - an album that delivers more raw versions of songs that span the band‚Äôs 20 year career, was released in February this year. Part 2 & 3 of the Franks series will be rolling out through 2025.

@graph.name: Cruel Diagonals, Mind Mirage, 55Castles
@graph.description: Mind Mirage has been sonically described as an ethereal underworld. She and darkwave band 55CASTLES are both Oakland CA-based, touring the Southwest this Spring. Mind Mirage has played LA a few times (Catherine Moan, Caress, Drowse) since debuting live in 2022. This will be 55CASTLES' 1st LA show. Supporting acts are the gems Cruel Diagonals (stunning otherlands) and DJ Dolomedes (Aurat).

@graph.name: The Sextones with support from The Silvertone
@graph.description:
Founded in 2015, The Sextones built a devoted following across the West Coast before

breaking out internationally with their self-released 2017 debut album Moonlight Vision, quickly

finding success in Japan via P-Vine Records. Soon after, the band began touring extensively

across the U.S. and Europe, quickly garnering international attention from soul music fans,

record collectors, and critics alike. A steady roster of national performances cemented their

reputation as critical and festival favorites, with Okayplayer describing Moonlight Vision as ‚ÄúThe

result of a Herculean work ethic, mixed with a Sherlock Holmes-esque attention to detail and a

nuance that can be appreciated by true music lovers.‚Äù Live For Live Music detailed their musical

approach, writing: ‚ÄúBy taking classic sounds, modernizing them, and making them their own, the

Sextones have carved out a niche for themselves within the modern funk and soul movement,

and we are digging every second of it." And PopDust praised the group as ‚ÄúA glowing reminder

of where music came from, and serves as a vehicle to light a fire under a new generation.‚Äù

Friends since childhood, The Sextones are Mark Sexton (guitar, vocals), Alexander Korostinsky

(bass), Daniel Weiss (drums), and Christopher Sexton (piano). Having known each other for so

long, their musical chemistry is effortless and forms the foundation of the band‚Äôs longevity and

creative workflow. Despite their bond, each member has been able to channel their creativity

into other acclaimed groups‚ÄîAlexander and Mark with their cinematic-soul project Whatitdo

Archive Group and Daniel's recent engagement in the soul/jazz group Delvon Lamarr Organ

Trio. Flexing their creative muscle individually has only strengthened The Sextones‚Äô collective

songwriting ability and heralds their formidable return to the spotlight with their upcoming record

this fall. With their recent signing to heavy-weight soul label, Record Kicks, the self-made heroes

of soul begin a new chapter in their sonic journey, ready to scale new heights and plumb deep

emotional depths in service of the genre they love.

@graph.name: Damaged Disco presents Science in Nature, Warsaw Pact and Bite Marx
@graph.description:
Damaged Disco Presents the record release show for Science in Nature (ex-Members of The Faint, Soft Kill, Moving Units) with Warsaw Pact and Bite Marx on Friday April 18 at Gold-Diggers!

Science in Nature is the practice of aligning patterns with naturally occurring phenomena. Working largely without sonic or lyrical distortion and within the deliberate borders of a traditional 3-piece rock band, we exist somewhere inside the awkwardness of a new dance and the routine of strained muscle memory. Los Angeles‚Äô Joel Petersen (ex-The Faint, Broken Spindles) is on guitar and vocals, Han-Su Kim is on bass and harmony vocals, and Danny Deleon (Soft Kill, Moving Units) is on drums. Our sum is greater than our parts. We feel tension in the spaces‚Äîand beauty in the clarity. Please enjoy with us.

Bringing punk back into post-punk, Warsaw Pact sits anxiously on the edge of the LA Goth scene, trading angular guitar riffs with up tempo dance-punk beats backed by a brooding bass line and the urgent yet melodramatic vocals of Ivan Delint. Originally Ivan Delint‚Äôs solo project, the band has grown to include guitarist Steven Rivera (Shrouds), drummer Lock Noble, and Luis Posadas on Bass. They have opened for touring acts including ACTORS, Pink Turns Blue, and Modern English.

Bite Marx founder Colin Ambulance has been creating genuine, neurotic, verbose, aphoristic, and lurid electro/synth/postpunk since 2016, with his intense live performances now accompanied by a backing band including Annette Badalian on synth.

@graph.name: HELL FEASTER with I Speak Machine and special guest Lana Del Rabies
@graph.description: HELL FEASTER - I Speak Machine and Lana Del Rabies will host an Easter Eve industrial mass to summon the undead just in time for the apocalypse. Featuring operatic, screaming synthpunk and experimental gothic industrial noise for all who seek salvation.
